snippet: Petitions calling for a November vote to repeal new rights were filed, but polls suggest the electorate is more evenly divided than it has been in other states.
abstract: Polls indicate that impending battle over Washington State's same-sex marriage law is likely to be an evenly-matched fight, with a majority of residents favoring equal legal rights for gay couples; consortium of groups seeking to repeal the law at the ballot box will have to tread more lightly than they have in more conservative states.
lead_paragraph: Petitions calling for a November vote to repeal new rights were filed, but polls suggest the electorate is more evenly divided than it has been in other states.

headline.seo: Gay-Marriage Opponents Face Tougher Test in Washington State
headline.main: Opponents of Gay Marriage Face Tougher Test in Washington State
headline.print_headline: Opponents of Gay Marriage Face Tougher Test in Washington State

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
